content.question: Which of the following best explains the level of turnout in an AP Comparative Government and Politics course country?

choices.label: Turnout in Iranian presidential elections is generally low because it is an authoritarian regime.
Although turnout in Russian presidential elections is relatively high, documented cases of voter fraud make the numbers suspect.
Turnout in Nigerian presidential elections has increased significantly due to a campaign to stop corruption.
Turnout in Mexican presidential elections has been significantly increasing over time because the government has a high level of legitimacy.

content.answer: Although turnout in Russian presidential elections is relatively high, documented cases of voter fraud make the numbers suspect.

topic.text: 3.5: Nature and Role of Political Participation

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
